name: sp
content:

[ C usually singular ] abbreviation for
starting price : the amount of money offered just at the start of a race by a bookmaker for a winning bet (= money risked): Under the new system, prices will be sent straight from bookmakers' computers to machinery which will calculate the SP at the "off". the SP
[ S ] informal information about a person or situation: Meet him outside the post office at midday. Give him the SP on the situation. We buy undercover from 10 vendors and give you the full SP on their sales, delivery, build quality and support.
More examplesFewer examplesThe point of the SP system is that it reflects the on-course market and is not directly controlled by the off-course bookmakers.He lowered his voice. "Come on, Bruv. What's the SP?"A little bird told me you could give me the SP on their little operation.
